p: ‘Silent’ CDV epidemics have been observed in the Serengeti–Mara ecosystem, where serological analyses have shown an increase in the exposure to CDV in spotted hyenas and lions without obvious clinical signs, high mortality, or a reduction in population size [ 49, 65, 66, 67], as observed during the lethal epidemic of 1993–1994 in these species. Spotted hyenas from the Maasai Mara National Reserve were more exposed to CDV than those near to human settlements, showing that in this case, domestic dogs may not be the only animals that transmit CDV to these wild species [ 66].
